skills.title: Programming Languages

work.name: University of Oklahoma
bullets: Assisted with grading, held office hours and helped students. Bellow are the classes I have been a teaching assistant for.
Machine Learning, Intelligent Robotics and Cryptography.

work.name: Paycom
bullets: Developed and implemented an algorithm for detecting and cleaning unused Cascading Style Sheets.
Designed the back-end coding-architecture (an abstract class in C#) for a quicker search system in the company’s database using Elasticsearch.
Helped in automating a well-defined procedure the employees went through to log in their billable hours by extending and refactoring pre-written PHP code.

work.name: LASSO Centre
bullets: Debugged and helped new Computer Science students with their code.
Planned study and lectures sessions.
Lead individual and study groups of new Computer Science students.

work.name: Greenvale Elementary
bullets: Provided technical and administrative support.
Assisted with the management of the classroom.

work.name: Boathouse District & Riversport Adventures
bullets: Inspected the equipment including sky-trail, ensuring it meets organisation's security criteria and quality control et cetera.
Directed small crowds in rides & attractions and supervised kayaks in the downtown river.

research.name: Satellite to Ground Quantum Key Distribution
bullets: Studied theoretical foundations of quantum mechanics, e. g., Hilbert spaces etc.
Presented the famous paper that lead to the launch of Chinese quantum satellite: Micius.

research.name: Integer Factorisation with Feed-forward Neural Networks
bullets: Experimented empirically with semi-primes p of order 2²⁰.
Implemented a minimal Feed-forward network that could perform factorisation of aforementioned p.

research.name: Error & Noise Analysis in a Quantum Key Exchange
bullets: Analysed the effects noise has on a Quantum Key Exchange through empirical modelling and machine learning algorithms such as linear, logistic regression, k-means and neural networks.

research.name: Simulations to Study Transportation & Habitat for Deep Space
bullets: Discussed the adoption of simulation based design approaches to support the study of transportation and assembly alternatives in deep space.
Published and presented at 2018 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics.

research.name: Application and Study of Cryptography Algorithms
bullets: Implemented in Sage-Python cryptographic algorithms such as Diﬀie-Hellman, RSA and Elliptic Curves, while examining their mathematical background, and possibility of quantum safe algorithms such as NTRU.

honors.title: Summa Cum Laude
honors.description: Institutional Honours for Computer Science and Mathematics
